p: Total flavonoid screening was evaluated by using the method of aluminium chloride colorimetric described by Adedapo et al. (2008). An aliquot amount of 0.5 mL of each sample was added to 0.5 mL of 2% (w/v) AlCl 3 ethanolic solution and mixed gently. The mixtures were left at room temperature for 90 min and the absorbance was read at 440 nm using a microplate reader against a blank. The presence of flavonoids was confirmed by the appearance of a yellow colour. Quercetin was used as a standard. The flavonoid content was established in milligrams equivalents of quercetin per milligram of each fraction using the standard curve.
